com.jidesoft.combobox
Class PopupPanel

java.lang.Object
  |

        |
        +--java.awt.Container

              +--javax.swing.JComponent

                    +--javax.swing.JPanel

                          +--com.jidesoft.combobox.PopupPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ColorChooserPanel, DateChooserPanel, FileChooserPanel, ListChooserPanel, MonthChooserPanel
public class PopupPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.ItemSelectable

This PopupPanel is part of AbstractComboBox. ComboBox usually needs a popup panel, either as drop down or a dialog. In either case, it is used to select something. All subclasses of AbstractComboBox should use PopupPanel or subclass of PopupPanel to create a panel that can be used by AbstractComboBox.
PopupPanel extends JPanel. In addition, it implements ItemSelectable interface. It also can take ItemListener so that any selection change event can be fired.

See Also:
Serialized Form

stretchToFit

public boolean stretchToFit()
If this panel can be stretch to be the same width as combox for example.
Default is false.

Returns:
true if this panel can be stretched.

needsButtons

public boolean needsButtons()
Some popup panel doesn't have a OK or Cancel button to confirm the selection. If so, when showing the popup panel in dialog, addtional buttons such as "OK", "Cancel" and "Reset" will be added. So return true if this popup panel need those button; and false if no button is needed.
Default is true.

Returns:
true if those select buttons need to be added
